Every person living in this country has the right to quality health coverage. Full stop. The #MedicareforAll Act makes this a reality. No deductibles, no co-pays. Just good healthcare. Thank you @RulesDemocrats for holding this historic hearing on #M4A! pic.twitter.com/nevNEkfBpe
Today’s hearing on #MedicareforAll is a historic step toward fulfilling the vision of universal healthcare. The time to act is now.

Today, Congress is holding the first hearing on the Equal Rights Amendment in 36 years with @RepSpeier @RepMaloney @PattyArquette! We won’t rest until the ERA is ratified to our Constitution & women and men are equal under the eyes of the law #ERAHearing #ERANow
Dr. Artis, President of @BenedictEDU says that it's incumbent on the SBA to reach out to #HBCUs and provide resources. #HBCUsMatter

#HealthDisparities in communities of color are caused by:
•Lack of access to healthy food
•Inadequate medical care
•Pollution & environmental factors
We must fight these systemic injustices so our communities are healthier! #MinorityHealthMonth #NMHM19

Dr. Dillard, President of @ShawUniversity points out many of our #HBCUs are located in underserved communities and small businesses in those communities  could benefit from students to help get businesses up and running. #HBCUsMatter

Dr. Casson, Dean of the Business School at @DelStateUniv says a viable partnership between HBCUs and the SBA could provide the necessary platform to engage the African American small business community and plug the resource gap. #HBCUsMatter
Dr. Harvey, Dean of @HowardHUSB says access to capital is a major challenge to Black entrepreneurs and recommends the SBA develop a loan program in partnership with HBCUs. #HBCUsMatter

@RepHoulahan asks SBA if they measure the impact and reach of their outreach to non-HBCUs. The answer is yes. We MUST ensure #HBCUs have the same access to federal resources as their peer institutions. #HBCUsMatter

The SBA needs to do more than talk the talk. They need to walk the walk. Historically, HBCUs have always been at a disadvantage when it comes to federal resources, and this report shows us the SBA has a lot of work to do.
That's why I started the Bipartisan HBCU Caucus and the HBCU Partnership Challenge. So far, nearly 25 companies across a diverse set of industries and sectors have taken the pledge.
I have dedicated my life to #HBCUs. I attended an #HBCU, I taught at an HBCU. I know firsthand what these schools can do and how important they are. #HBCUsMatter

@RepDwightEvans says SBA strategic alliances with #HBCUs don't seem worth the paper they're written on. We need more than symbolism. We need strong and lasting partnerships to guide the next generation of Black entrepreneurs. #HBCUsMatter
GAO witness Anna Maria Ortiz: SBA has limited data on its relationship with #HBCUs and very little information about the state of its partnerships. This is unacceptable and we must address it!
GAO witness tells hearing #HBCU outreach doesn't appear to be a priority at the Small Business Administration.

Two years ago, I set out to determine whether the Small Business Administration was doing enough to partner with HBCUs. Today, I'm proud to join @HouseSmallBiz for a hearing to determine how the SBA can do better in creating strong and lasting partnerships with HBCUs.

HBCUs are producing the next generation of Black entrepreneurs. Is the SBA doing enough to support them? @HouseSmallBiz is holding a hearing on NOW SBA engagement with #HBCUs.  Watch live here:  https://bit.ly/2H0Kpy0  #HBCUsMatter
